lead_paragraph: Sam Pollock, who built a dynasty as vice president and general manager of the Montreal Canadiens in the 1960s and 1970s, has died. He was 81.A moment of silence was held before the Toronto Blue Jays’ game at Rogers Centre last night in honor of Pollock, who was an executive with the team after leaving Montreal. Pollock set the standard by which other N.H.L. general managers have been measured. As the architect of the dynasties, Pollock was considered the shrewdest evaluator and dealer of talent of his era.
